definitions.definition: That which is affirmed ; a declaration that something is true .

A solemn pledge (to tell the truth , to bear allegiance , etc.), legally equivalent to an oath , taken by people who are forbidden to take a religious oath (such as Quakers ) or otherwise prefer not to do so.
A form of self-forced meditation or repetition; autosuggestion .

main_definition: That which is affirmed ; a declaration that something is true .
secondary_definitions: ( law ) A solemn pledge (to tell the truth , to bear allegiance , etc.), legally equivalent to an oath , taken by people who are forbidden to take a religious oath (such as Quakers ) or otherwise prefer not to do so.
A form of self-forced meditation or repetition; autosuggestion .
